entry.title: [IntersectionOptimization] New invalidation strategy
entry.content:
The original invalidation method tried to catch under-invalidations

(and it did) but caused unacceptable performance regressions in

PrePaint.



Now I'm focusing on scroll performance for IntersectionOptimization.

- If anything changed affecting layout or transform, schedule full

intersection observation update.

- If only things changed affecting scroll or visibility (IOv2),

schedule kScrollOrVisibilityOnly update which will update

trackVisibility observers and observations whose

min-scroll-delta-to-update is exceeded by accumulated scroll delta

in the frame.

- Otherwise skip intersection optimization.



If we do an update, we'll ignore cached rects, to avoid

under-invalidation issues and the cost to invalidate.



Bug: 40883761

Change-Id: I84a57adc7d1f70fbfa5500a800a745b0e294b3ee

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273055

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258019}

entry.title: [iOS][ffr] Support VoiceOver on swipe to incognito IPH
entry.content:
This CL enables VoiceOver users to see and hear the announcement for

swipe-to-incognito IPH. The user will see the reduced-motion version of

the IPH and hear the announcement at the same time; the view will be

dismissed as soon as the announcement stops, either because the user

initiates a swipe to the next accessibility element or that the screen

reader simply finishes the announcement.



Additionally, the initializer of GestureInProductHelpView is updated

to include an optional string for VoiceOver users only. This is

because the experience for VoiceOver users are different from others,

and may user different terminologies for the same type of action.

This is advised by the a11y team.



A new dismissal reason is also added to metrics, since it cannot be

determined whether the announcement has finished reading on dismissal,

or is interrupted by the user.



Bug: b:40276959

Change-Id: I9adf06a60551213688ccaa181ff9261bbd671074

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277700

Reviewed-by: Louis Romero

entry.title: [ios] Improve saving preferences in ApplicationContextImpl
entry.content:
Ensure that local state prefs and all ChromeBrowserStates' prefs are

saved when the application transition to foreground/background. This

happens before the application is terminated and thus should make it

more likely that the prefs are saved even if the watchdog kill the

app because the save takes too long.



Also, ensure that the transition to foreground/background save the

same set of preferences (previously local state was saved when the

app entered foreground while ChromeBrowserStates' prefs were saved

when the app entered background).



To this end, introduce `OnAppEnterState(...)` helper method to deal

with transition to either state, allowing to share any common code

while still correctly dealing with action that should only happen

when transitioning to either of foreground/background.



Bug: 41495439

Change-Id: I9eea3fcb687af8abc658c03e195643b0bae2eb7d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273155

entry.title: Add conversions from arrays of bytes to integers/floats
entry.content:
This is a common use case of memcpy(), and by providing a well-typed

API for this, we can catch mistakes at compile time, and ensure bounds

are checked at runtime if not.



These functions are all constexpr. To do that we need to provide our

own constexpr byteswap (until C++23), so that is done as well. We

forward calls to the base::SwapBytes over to the base::numerics

one.



This helps us avoid writing verbose use of spans and byte copies when

we're trying to go between bytes and primitives, such as:

uint32_t val;

base::byte_span_from_ref(val).copy_from(

base::as_byte_span(array).first());



Instead, we write:

uint32_t val = U64FromLeBytes(

base::as_byte_span(array).first());



Which is a compile-time bounds-checked, and always-initialized version

of what we used to write as:

uint32_t val;

// SAFETY: Hope that array is large enough, and that we don't change

// the type of u32_val one day.

memcpy(&val, array.data(), sizeof(uint32_t));



R=davidben@chromium.org



Bug: 1490484, 1519908

Change-Id: Iedb412c7b21fab79fbb49b4ae4acfc072dd75c7d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5245758

Reviewed-by: David Benjamin

entry.content:
The unsafe_buffer_usage pragma was added in Clang 17 and we use it to

prevent -Wunsafe-buffer-usage from firing when wrapped in

UNSAFE_BUFFERS(). Since cronet bots don't know about the pragma, the

pragma causes an error.

entry.title: Save SessionIdGenerator seed to prefs on increment
entry.content:
The preferences are only saved to disk periodically, which can lead

to them not being saved if the app crashes soon after returning a

new id.



This can lead to duplicate id if the code that uses the new id save

it to another location with less delay and then the application crash

before the prefs has been saved. This has been observed on iOS in the

wild.



To limit the risk of this happening, store the value to prefs when

it is incremented, including when adding kCautionaryIdPadding. On

iOS, this solves the issue on iOS since on that system, the prefs

are saved unconditionally as part of the application startup after

calling SessionIdGenerator::Init().



Bug: 41495439

Change-Id: I2538c328dced802787928577c5ceccd48f2f35e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272360

entry.title: Add a helper for calling `QuicSessionRequest::Request`
entry.content:
This file is very long, not least because QuicSessionRequest::Request

has too many arguments. This refactor adds a helper that applies the

defaults, and allows overriding the args relevant to a test. This was

tedious to write and will be tedious to review, and I apologize.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust""
entry.content:
This reverts commit c37505129ee027a86b3416141230a27516fba43b.



Reason for revert: suspect for crbug.com/324418102



Original change's description:

> Reland "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust"

>

> This is a reland of commit e5f6f1434e631cd1c8154a41ee95ce6126688e9a.

> The only difference is: disabling a test that conflicts with

> the new implementation (see b/323984075).

>

> Original change's description:

> > Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust

> >

> > See chromium:1508245 for context.

> >

> > - Decide whether crosapi is enabled based on the command line

> > switches. In particular, make it independent of when/whether

> > BrowserTestBase::SetUp gets called.

> > We still provide DisableCrosapiForTesting for legacy reasons,

> > as some tests need to ovrerride it.

> >

> > - This, plus some new checks, make it hard for tests

> > * to accidentally and silently override the Ash-provided init

> > params with mostly empty ones, or

> > * to accidentally and silently prevent the Ash-provided params

> > from even being read.

> >

> > - Address a TODO in InProcessBrowserTest thanks to these changes.

> >

> > - Call DisableCrosapiForTesting in ViewsTestBase-derived tests that

> > run with crosapi enabled but are not prepared to set it up (and thus

> > would fail one of the new checks) and in fact don't need crosapi.

> >

> > - Remove InProcessBrowserTest::IsCrosapiEnabled() in favor of

> > !chromeos::BrowserParamsProxy::IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting(). There

> > is no need to have the InProcessBrowserTest predicate and it's not

> > an InProcessBrowserTest level concept.

> >

> > - Remove ScopedDisableCrosapiForTesting class, as there is no need for

> > a scope. Tests should either not call DisableCrosapiForTesting at

> > all or should do it very early on (CHECK'd). Undoing it is not

> > supported and it's not neceesary because tests run in separate

> > processes.

> >

> > - Add documentation to startup/README.md.

> >

> > - Remove some uses of IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting from production code

> > that are no longer needed.

> >

> > Bug: chromium:1508245

> > Change-Id: Id6b68a25dae4c50132f957f4b80879fdcde2e7b2

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5076190

entry.title: [Tab State] Fix NPE for null tab group ID in FlatBuffer
entry.content:
Any users that wrote flat buffer tab states prior to

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5258703 will

have a null tabGroupId field. I forgot to account for this when using

a struct rather than two longs for the token as longs have a default 0

value, but structs default to null.



This CL handles the NPE gracefully by only attempting to read the

struct if it is non-null and assuming the tabGroupId is zero/null/empty

otherwise and not setting it.



Fixed: b/324321591

Change-Id: I39d4be65110cc638655e6812e8e65d4d90184b2b

entry.title: [ios] Change OrderController::DetermineNewActiveIndex() API
entry.content:
The API of OrderController::DetermineNewActiveIndex() was difficult

to use at it returned the new index of the active element after the

removal of the item was enacted however some of the clients updated

the WebStateList active_index() to the returned value immediately.



Currently, this worked in all situation because the value was used

incorrectly only when removing the tail of the list, so the index

was always before the first detached element, and thus valid.



Change the API of OrderController::DetermineNewActiveIndex() to

return the index of the new active index before closing the elements

scheduled for removal, and update client code that wants the index

after removal to use RemovingIndex::IndexAfterRemoval(...) on the

value.



Fix unit tests.



Bug: none

Change-Id: Ic9cba28db06be8541ea1cdcc828d0a7445b42ba0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5259239

Reviewed-by: Asami Doi

entry.title: media: Update accelerators for Copy/Save/Search video frame context menu items
entry.content:
In video context menu, some menu items are assigned a accelerator.

When we added Copy/Save/Search video frame feature, we reused some

existing hotkeys, causing confusion and inconvenience.



We should use unique keys for these options instead of reusing existing

ones to avoid breaking previous experiences.



Here's the new accelerators:

- "Copy video frame": "y"

- Same as "Copy Image" which also uses "y"

- "Save video frame as: "f"

- No example to follow. Choose "f" for "frame"

- "Search video frame with Google": "s"

- Same as "Search images with Google"



Before and after comparison:



|------------------------| ------|-----|

| | Accelerator |

| -----------------------| ------|-----|

| Menu Item | Old | New |

|------------------------| ------|-----|

| Open video in new tab | o | o |

| Copy video frame | o | y |

| Copy video address | o | o |

| Save video frame as | v | f |

| Search video frame | n/a | s |

|------------------------| ------|-----|



Skipping translation screenshots check because those screenshots

have already been uploaded and this CL doesn't change how they

look like.



Skip-Translation-Screenshots-Check: True

Bug: 324282445

Test: Manually tested on Linux

Change-Id: I6cd2e05108ce1bb5b2c651701c370047201fe7c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277575

Commit-Queue: Peter Kasting

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

entry.title: Fix restrictions on the autofill popup height.
entry.content:
The height of the popup was restricted (before defining the arrow side)

by the available space below or above the target element. The popup

can be shown on the left and right which makes such restrictions

unreasonable. Fixed by removing this preliminary height clipping,

which will happen later if necessary.

entry.title: webview: Make FPS component available on WebView
entry.content:
Shifting over the component installer to components so that we can share

this with WebView.



FPS needs to be a blocking call before other network calls because of

privacy concerns around leaking user state so we need to always call the

FPS component loader once, and as soon as possible. The good news is

that this is somewhat simplified in WebView as we rely on a separate

component loader (the component updater code running within the embedded

process), from the component installer (the code running in the shared

non-embedded process that downloads the component). The component loader

runs super early on at WebViews start up and we will get a single call

for either a component load failure, or success.



We have to pop this behind a command line switch because we can't gate

the component installer behind a feature flag since we don't have finch

in the non-embedded process.



I tested this by verifying that the first party sets component loader

show the sets file as read. Didn't test beyond that because there is

still a lot of other code for first party sets in //chrome so it is

unlikely we will see this affect APIs like the storage access API yet.



Bug: 324104312

entry.title: Improve DE parsing rules to support address lines.
entry.content:
The CL updates the parsing rules for Germany, by introducing a

DecompositionCascade. To decompose street addresses the cascade does

the following:



1. If the street address has multiple lines (separated by newline characters), matches address line 1 as location location and overflow

as the rest.

2. If there is a single address line, try decomposing the entire street

address in smaller pieces using the previous mechanism.



See the public repo pull request for reference.

https://github.com/battre/autocomplete-attribute-explainer/pull/39

entry.title: Fix crash when manually opening DefaultStoreChanged bubble
entry.content:
The crash happened because of a CHECK failure. Check assumes that the

bubble was triggered automatically and thus that the default store

pref value must be different than the current account store opt in

status. That is not true if the user closed and then manually reopened

this bubble, because at this point the default store pref was already

changed.

entry.title: Establish display item fragment scope for atomic inlines.
entry.content:
We already did this when painting text items and inline box items

(non-atomic inlines), but we also need to do it when painting atomic

inlines.



Although it's rather unusual for an atomic inline LayoutObject to be

associated with multiple fragment items, it may happen if an atomic

inline is associated with a text-overflow ellipsis (that's a fragment

item of type kGeneratedText).



A text-overflow ellipsis fragment item is associated with the last

LayoutObject that fits before the ellipsis, and if this happens to be an

atomic inline (e.g. an image), it will be that one.



To explain what went wrong in the test included: There's a SPAN with two

lines inside. Two fragment items are created for the SPAN. The item on

the first line gets fragment ID 0, and the one one the second line gets

ID 1. On the second line there's an image followed by something that

gets clipped by overflow, and there will be a text-overflow ellipsis.

The image is the last (and only, actually) object that fits, so the

ellipsis gets associated with that object. Two fragment items are

created for the image object, first the image itself, and then the

ellipsis. They get a fragment ID of 0 and 1, respectively.



When painting the SPAN on the second line, we establish a fragment item

scope for it, and the ID is 1. When we paint the actual image, we didn't

establish a scope, so that ID 1 was used for the image as well (even

though its fragment ID is 0). When painting the ellipsis afterwards, we

establish a scope, with ID 1. Because of this we got the same display

item client (from the layout object) painted twice with the same

fragment ID.



Bug: 41493875

Change-Id: I5fc87fc086ecd3c4367dca7c3ad94c22c031f7f7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272607

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257896}

entry.title: Rename {absl => std}::optional in //net/
entry.content:
#cleanup



Automated patch. This is a no-op. Please avoid, as much as possible,

assigning unrelated bugs to this.



Context:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/nBD_1LaanTc/m/ghh-ZZhWAwAJ?utm_medium=email



As of https://crrev.com/1204351, absl::optional is now a type alias

for std::optional. We should migrate toward it.



Script:

```

cd net

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

-e "\.mm" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}

replace "absl::make_optional" "std::make_optional"

replace "absl::optional" "std::optional"

replace "absl::nullopt" "std::nullopt"

replace "absl::in_place" "std::in_place"

replace "absl::in_place_t" "std::in_place_t"

replace "\"third_party\/abseil-cpp\/absl\/types\/optional.h\"" ""

cd ..



git status

echo "Formatting"



echo "IncludeBlocks: Regroup" >> ".clang-format"

echo "IncludeIsMainRegex: \"(_(android|apple|chromeos|freebsd|fuchsia|fuzzer|ios|linux|mac|nacl|openbsd|posix|stubs?|win))?(_(unit|browser|perf)?tests?)?$\"" >> ".clang-format"

git cl format

git restore ".clang-format"

```

entry.title: webrtc: Propagate devtools token to P2PSocketUdp constructors
entry.content:
A DevTools token is required by the ThrottlingController APIs in order

to implement throttling for WebRTC.

This adds a new probe to fetch the token from the InspectorNetworkAgent

and propagate it through the Mojo API to the P2PSocketManager and the

P2PSocketUdp constructor where it will be used.

entry.title: CookieSettings: Limit combination of test parameters
entry.content:
CookieSettings unit tests use parameterized tests to try the same test

for different features that can provide grants or blocks. This leads

to each test being run 2^n times. Most of these executions are

redundant

since e.g. two different sources of a grant don't affect each others.

This CL reduces the number of combinations by only testing

those combinations that can interact. E.g. different grants and blocks.

New features won't lead to an exponential increase in tests anymore.



Tests are reduced from 1664 to 520 and 1120 to 630 for browser/ and

network/ tests





Change-Id: I45691389937cf8865e5427076d92f7378a52450d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5210597

Commit-Queue: Christian Dullweber

Reviewed-by: Chris Fredrickson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257879}

entry.title: Load pending images when animating display
entry.content:
We stored a base style during display animations with pending images

because we skipped loading images when the display was 'none'. That is a

problem when re-using the base style for the animation when display

becomes non-'none' when animating display. The ElementStyleResources

does not contain the pending image for that frame, but the paint code

will start accessing the image when the box is rendered.



Solving this by loading pending resources for display:none if we are

animating the display property.



Bug: 41487025

Change-Id: Ibbff30c77ba8c6aa62f5909aefd831b7d9d523b7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273193

entry.title: Add UI test for extension handling for supervised users
entry.content:
A new test suite su/extensions_interactive_uitest

confirms that the Parent approval dialog, or the

Blocked extensions message is shown to a child user when they

try to enable an extension pending parent approval.

The test consumes the Permissions switch from FL which controls

how extensions are handled for supervised users.



The test can use different households to check that the Permissions

switch is received in Chrome for different DMA 5.2 situations.

entry.title: [passwords] Fix leak detection with UsesSplitStoresAndUPMForLocal()
entry.content:
When UsesSplitStoresAndUPMForLocal() is true, it means the profile

password store does not upload data even if sync is on. Hence,

CredentialLeakFlags::kPasswordSynced should never be used for the

profile store.



This primarily influences what IsPasswordSynced() returns. In

reality, it appears that this function isn't used on Android, so the

patch appears to be a no-op (but hard to verify with certainty).

entry.title: Update last interacted form when JS modifies a field's value
entry.content:
Autofill is currently working on replacing the observer it uses for

disappearing elements by a direct blink connection notifying of removals

and hiding of elements.



Some notification about hidden elements are provided to Autofill during

style recalc (e.g. changing visibility attribute to 'hidden') and during

this Autofill is not allowed to query the focusability of a node.



This causes a problem for Autofill: When submission is inferred,

Autofill tries to extract the form of the element it was tracking, and

part of this is querying the focusability of fields. Which means that

if submission is inferred from a notification sent during style recalc,

Autofill is not allowed to extract a form at submission time.



The alternative is to use the provisionally saved form, which is a form

that Autofill updates on autofill operations and user edits. In this

context, form means either an HTML
tagged section or the

collection of all unowned control elements.



This CL tries to make the provisionally saved form approach the state of

the extracted form at submission time (should we have extracted it)

by also updating it on JS changes. To achieve that, we modify the signal

JavaScriptModifiedAutofilledValue to JavaScriptModifiedValue.



Note that this update is only performed if JS modifies the form that is

already tracked by autofill. Which means that only user edits and

autofill (also user triggered) have permission to change the form

tracked by autofill from one form to another, but JS only has permission

to update the currently tracked form.



The CL also adds logic to default to the provisionally save form

unconditionally at submission time instead of extraction.



All behavior changes are gated behind a feature flag.



Bug: 1483242

Change-Id: I34635ddbe88dc49aeb31e23f2999e7bca95952bb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5238376

Reviewed-by: Dominic Battre

Reviewed-by: Christoph Schwering

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Jihad Hanna

entry.title: [ios] Fix hover effect for identity button
entry.content:
This CL fixes the hover effect of the identity button to match the

shape of the identity image.

There is no visible change on iPad.

Note that the clickable area is now smaller (with old implementation

all the square area around the button was clickable).



Old implementation:

- Size of the image

- Margin (16pt)



New implementation:

- Size of the image

- Margin (8pt)

- Padding (8pt)



As a result the clickable area will be 8pt*2 = 16pt smaller

(from 64pt to 48pt).

A screenshot of the new behavior can be found in the bug page.

entry.title: Do not use templates for ScriptPromiseResolver::ToV8 implementation
entry.content:
The usage of templates for reusing the internal implementation of ToV8

is not making the code simpler. So, inline the implementations.



This also fixes a GCC build issue because it was implemented with

template specializations declared in the class scope, and that is

hitting the GCC bug https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85282

entry.title: [//gpu] Clarify IOSurfaceImageBacking's retaining of GL texture
entry.content:
IOSurfaceImageBacking creates and retains its GL texture for its

lifetime when Skia is using GL. This was likely originally introduced

for legacy mailboxes, which don't create SharedImage representations

that otherwise cause the GL texture to be created. Legacy mailboxes are

no longer used on Mac at all. However, we have found that this behavior

nonetheless gives performance benefits for Ganesh vs. Graphite (which

recreates the texture on each BeginAccess() call). Hence, this CL

renames the variable and clarifies when it is created to be up-to-date

with its current usage.



Bug: 41497036

entry.title: [iOS][TS] Fix drop animation
entry.content:
When dropping a cell, its animation is not based on its contentView.

Sets the corner radius and the background color of the cell to match

its contentView.
